Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25) AMENDED 08-15-2016] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25) AMENDED 08-15-2016] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Sherrie Ann Cadd was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Sherrie Ann Cadd was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25) AMENDED 08-15-2016], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached amended criminal complaint. Conditions:   Do not drive unless properly licensed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11-7-2014:  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance to ZCI.**

**AMENDED 7-6-2015:  SCRAM is removed as a condition of bond.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance to ZCI.**

BTC:  Statements are admissible.  Motion to Join is granted.
Defense req bond mod to reduce cash.
State does not object to reduction of cash bond but notes that SCRAM was removed due to non-payment.  Req that SCRAM be reinstalled.
BTC:  Bond mod to reduce cash to $1000 cash each file.  Def must attend 5 mtgs/wk.  SCRAM is removed.  Defendant must test after each court appearance.

Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sherrie Ann Cadd in court with attorney Mark F Nielsen.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense asks for bond to reviewed to remove SCRAM. Defense asks for COP date. The State has never heard of the supposed health issues that defense indicates are associated with a pregnant woman wearing the SCRAM unit and until information is received from ZCI regarding such health issues, the State does not believe testing 3x per week is not adequate.

BTC: SCRAM to remain. ZCI has discretion to remove the unit if in fact it does pose a health issue. If the unit is removed, ZCI is to test 3x per week as well a random testing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
